item.title: Quadratics - TBD
item.description: Minimum and Maximum values Problem 1 Problem ↕ Find the minimum and maximum values of the function $$ y = 2x^2 - 4x+ 5 $$ Algebraic Solution ... $$ \begin{array}{rcl} y & = & 2x^2 - 4x+ 5 \\ \\ y & = & 2(x^2 - 2x) + 5 \\ \\ \therefore y & = & 2(x^2 - 2x + 1) + 3 \\ & & \text{Completing the square here}\\ \\ \therefore y & = & 2(x - 1)^2 + 3 \\ \end{array} $$ Answer ↕ Minimum value = 3, maximum value = \( \infty \), i.
